abstract: Middle school girls are transforming their lockers with fanciful decorations. Is it all good fun or consumerism run amok?
snippet: Middle school girls are transforming their lockers with fanciful decorations. Is it all good fun or consumerism run amok?
lead_paragraph: Middle-school girls are transforming their once-barren metal lockers with fanciful decorations that fully cover the drab chipped paint and Sharpie commentary of any former inhabitants. In today's Times, Elissa Gootman describes the "next frontier in nesting" - polka-dot chandeliers, zebra-print wallpaper, lime shag rugs and other decorating options.
